definition: to learn from experience (coll.)
to learn/to study/to imitate/science/-ology
(of a child) obedient, well-behaved/clever/shrewd/alert/perverse/contrary to reason/irregular/abnormal

sentences.english: We were afraid we'd have to up the voltage for a while, but he seems to have finally learned and the screams have lessened.
sentences.chinese: 现在他似乎终于学乖了一点，发出尖叫的次数也少了。

sentences.english: Then we helped her to bathe, spoke to her and taught her to behave well.
sentences.chinese: 后来我们帮她洗澡，同她说话，教她学乖。
那个蠢蛋什么时候才能学乖？

definition: to suffer/to suffer for one's actions/to pay dearly/to burn one's fingers
(coll.) to learn one's lesson/to have enough brains to learn from one's mistakes
sufferings
hidden loss (finance)
in order/in sequence/close to/adjacent to
to suffer/to endure/to pull through (hard times)/to delay/to stall/to play for time/to dawdle
to calm down/to stop/to pause/calmly/peaceful/restful
to take a beating/to get thrashed/to come under attack
to be beaten/to take a drubbing/buffeted/knocked about
to tuck one's tail between one's legs/fig. to back down/in a humiliating situation
content with one's lot/knowing one's place
to utter a word
Fall into the moat and you'll be wiser next time (idiom); One only learns from one's mistakes.
pinyin: chi1 yi1 qian4 , zhang3 yi1 zhi4

definition: to invite a snub/to court a rebuff
to offend
lesson/moral/to chide sb/to lecture sb
